metadata.Title: CVE-2020-8597 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
eap.c in pppd in ppp 2.4.2 through 2.4.8 has an rhostname buffer overflowin the eap_request and eap_response functions.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-8597` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ppp - 2.4.5-5.1ubuntu2.3+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: ppp package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.5-5.1ubuntu2.3+esm1').
